categories.name: First Party Collection/Use
categories.description: Privacy practice describing data collection or data use by the company/organization owning the website or mobile app.

attributes.name: Does/Does Not
attributes.description: Use this optional attribute to denote if the policy explicitly states that something is NOT done. Defaults to Does.

values.name: Does
values.description: The first party does engage in the described practice.

values.name: Does Not
values.description: The first party does not engage in the described practice.

attributes.name: Collection Mode
attributes.description: Use this optional attribute to denote if the data collection performed by the first party is implicit (e.g., company collects information without user's explicit awareness) or explicit (e.g., user provides information). Defaults to “not selected.”

values.name: Explicit
values.description: The company/organization collects or uses information that the user explicitly provides, e.g., the user enters information in a web form.

values.name: Implicit
values.description: The company/organization collects or uses information that the user does not explicitly provide, e.g., data is collected or transferred automatically in the background. The user may or may not have given consent to such implicit collection/use.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: It is not specified or unclear whether the information is collected explicitly or implicitly.

attributes.name: Action First-Party
attributes.description: How does the first party collect, track, or obtain user information?

values.name: Collect on website
values.description: The company/organization collects user information directly on the website.

values.name: Collect in mobile app
values.description: The company/organization has a mobile app and it collects user information through that platform.

values.name: Collect on mobile website
values.description: The company/organization has a mobile version of its website through which it collects user information. This value is only needed if the policy explicitly distinguishes between its normal and mobile websites.

values.name: Track user on other websites
values.description: The company/organization tracks its users’ activities when they visit other websites, typically without the user being aware of it.

values.name: Collect from user on other websites
values.description: This company/organization (the first party) has a widget or element on other websites, in which the user can explicitly provide data to the first party while being on the other website. For example, Facebook users can comment on news or other content on different websites and Facebook collects that data.

values.name: Receive from other parts of company/affiliates
values.description: The company/organization is part of a family of companies/organizations or has subsidiaries (e.g., physical store, other websites that belong to same company). It receives user information from those other units.

values.name: Receive from other service/third-party (unnamed)
values.description: The company/organization receives user information from an unnamed third-party (e.g., the policy just speaks of “data brokers” or "partners" in the abstract).

values.name: Receive from other service/third-party (named)
values.description: The company/organization acquires user information from a third party that is explicitly named (e.g., Facebook when the user signs in using Facebook account; or a specific "partner").

values.name: Other
values.description: The specified type of collection is not covered by the options above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: The type of collection is not specified or unclear, e.g., “We collect your personal information” without further specification whether the collection occurs on a website, an app, offline, etc.

attributes.name: Identifiability
attributes.description: Use this optional attribute if it is explicitly stated whether the information or data practice is linked to the user's identity or if it is anonymous. Defaults to "not selected."

values.name: Identifiable
values.description: It is explicitly stated that the information/data practice is linked to the user's identity.

values.name: Aggregated or anonymized
values.description: The collected data is anonymized (e.g., link to user's identity is removed) or aggregated (e.g., merged with other users' information so that it is not possible to uniquely identify a single user).

values.name: Other
values.description: The practice makes an explicit statement about identifiability that is not covered by the options above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: It’s not explicitly stated or unclear if the information/data practice is linked to the user's identity.

attributes.name: Personal Information Type
attributes.description: What category of information is collected or tracked by the company/organization?

values.name: Financial
values.description: Financial information, such as credit/debit card data, other payment information, credit scores, etc.

values.name: Health
values.description: Health Information, such as information about health conditions, prescriptions, medication, as well as health monitoring data, e.g., heart rate, step count, activity level, etc.

values.name: Contact
values.description: Contact Information, such as name, email address, phone number, street address, etc.

values.name: Location
values.description: Geo-location information (e.g., user's current location) regardless of granularity, i.e., could be exact location, ZIP code, city-level.

values.name: Demographic
values.description: Demographic Information, e.g., gender, age, occupation, education, etc.

values.name: Personal identifier
values.description: Identifiers that uniquely identify a person,e.g., SSN, driver's license number, etc.

values.name: User online activities
values.description: The user's online activities on the first party website/app or other websites/apps, e.g., pages visited, time spent on pages, general user behavior online, etc.

values.name: User profile
values.description: The user’s profile on the first-party website/app and its contents, e.g., data in user profile, data that user uploaded to website, user comments, user profile preferences, etc. This is common for websites/apps where users can create an account or profile, e.g., on twitter, youtube, Facebook, Amazon, etc.

values.name: Social media data
values.description: User profile and data from a social media website/app or other third party service to which the user gave the first party access, e.g., by connecting with Facebook, twitter, or other services. Exchanged data may include user profile, photos, comments, friends, etc.

values.name: IP address and device IDs
values.description: Permanent (e.g., device IDs, MAC address) or temporary (e.g., IP address) identifiers needed to establish a connection for the current browsing session.

values.name: Cookies and tracking elements
values.description: Identifiers locally stored on user's device by the company/organization or third-parties including cookies, beacons, or similar that are commonly used to uniquely identify users, but that are not essential to establish a connection with the user’s device or to provide a service.

values.name: Computer information
values.description: The type of operating system (OS) or web browser that the user uses, or similar computer or device information.

values.name: Survey data
values.description: Any data that is collected through surveys

values.name: Generic personal information
values.description: No specific type of information is mentioned, but the policy talks about “personal information” or “personal identifiable information” in general.

values.name: Other
values.description: A specific type of information not covered by the above categories.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: The type of information is not explicitly stated or unclear (e.g., refers to "information" very generically).

attributes.name: Purpose
attributes.description: What is the purpose of collecting or using user information?

values.name: Basic service/feature
values.description: Provide a service that the user explicitly requests and that is part of the website/app's basic service or functionality. Examples are watching a video, reading an article, making a purchase, creating an account, contacting the company, etc.

values.name: Additional service/feature
values.description: Provide a service that the user explicitly requests but that is not a necessary part of the website/app's basic service. Additional services/features may enhance user experience or add convenience but require additional data, e.g., social media integration, comments, blog participation, a store finder that needs location information, etc.

values.name: Advertising
values.description: To show ads that are either targeted to the specific user or not targeted.

values.name: Marketing
values.description: To contact the user to offer products,services, or other promotions (e.g., send marketing emails, calling or texting user with marketing messages). Marketing typically requires the use of contact information.

values.name: Analytics/Research
values.description: For understanding the website/app’s audience, improving the website/app, inform company strategy, or general research.

values.name: Personalization/Customization
values.description: For providing user with a personalized experience, e.g., by allowing to arrange how the website/app looks, based on the user’s preferences or language, etc.

values.name: Service Operation and Security
values.description: For website/app operation and security, enforcement of terms of service, fraud prevention, protecting users and property, etc.

values.name: Legal requirement
values.description: For compliance with legal obligations, e.g., regulations, government data requests, government retention requests, law enforcement requests in general, etc.

values.name: Merger/Acquisition
values.description: If company/organization merges or is acquired it transfers users' information to another company/organization.

values.name: Other
values.description: Other specific purpose not covered above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: The purpose is not explicitly stated or is unclear.

attributes.name: User Type
attributes.description: Use this optional attribute if this practice applies specifically to users with an account or users without an account.

values.name: User without account
values.description: This data practice specifically applies to users that do not have an account or are not registered with the website or mobile app.

values.name: User with account
values.description: This data practice specifically applies to users with an account or who are registered with the website or mobile app.

values.name: Other
values.description: This data practice applies to a specific user type not covered by the options above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: It is not specified whether this practice applies to users with or without account.

attributes.name: Choice Type
attributes.description: Use this optional attribute if user choices are explicitly offered for this practice. Defaults to “not selected.”

values.name: Dont use service/feature
values.description: Only option is not to use the feature or service. Only select this if explicitly stated in policy (i.e., don't interpret silence as "Don't use website or feature").

values.name: Opt-in
values.description: User must consent before data can be collected or used by first party.

values.name: Opt-out link
values.description: Link provided in privacy policy, on website, in mobile app, or in email, etc.

values.name: Opt-out via contacting company
values.description: Must contact company via email, phone, or postal mail to opt-out.

values.name: First-party privacy controls
values.description: Website/app provides user settings for privacy configuration.

values.name: Third-party privacy controls
values.description: Choices provided by a third party (e.g., privacy settings on social media site) or industry (e.g., AdChoices Opt-out).

values.name: Browser/device privacy controls
values.description: Policy suggests the use of browser or mobile device’s privacy settings, e.g., to block trackers or cookies, activate Do-Not-Track, disable location sharing, clear history, etc.

values.name: Other
values.description: Other specific user choice or control option not captured above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: No user choices mentioned for this practice.

attributes.name: Choice Scope
attributes.description: Use this optional attribute to indicate the scope of user choices. In some cases, even if user choices are not clear or specific, this attribute can be selected. Defaults to “not selected.”

values.name: Collection
values.description: Choices apply to collection only.

values.name: Use
values.description: Choices apply to use only.

values.name: Both
values.description: Choices apply to both collection and use.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: No specific scope of choices is mentioned.

categories.name: Third Party Sharing/Collection
categories.description: Privacy practice describing data sharing with third parties or data collection by third parties. A third party is a company/organization other than the first party  company/organization that owns the website or mobile app.

attributes.name: Third Party Entity
attributes.description: The third-party involved in the data practice.

values.name: Unnamed third party
values.description: The third party is not explicitly named, i.e., it is just generically referred to as "third-party," "partner," or similar.

values.name: Named third party
values.description: The third party is explicitly named (e.g. Facebook) or at least characterized (e.g., “advertising partner” or “data broker”).

values.name: Other part of company/affiliate
values.description: Data is made available to other parts of the company/organization, e.g., it is shared with other services, apps, or websites operated by the company, could also be data exchange between online and offline company units (e.g. physical stores).

values.name: Other users
values.description: The third-party involved are other users of the first party website or mobile app.

values.name: Public
values.description: User information is made public or can be obtained from public sources.

values.name: Other
values.description: Other specific third-party entity not covered above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: The third-party entity is not specified. This is uncommon, "unnamed third-party" will likely be the right value instead.

attributes.name: Does/Does Not
attributes.description: Use this optional attribute to denote if the policy explicitly states that something is NOT done. Defaults to Does.

values.name: Does
values.description: The third party does engage in the described practice.

values.name: Does Not
values.description: The third party does not engage in the described practice.

attributes.name: Action Third Party
attributes.description: How does the third-party receive, collect, track, or see user information.

values.name: Receive/Shared with
values.description: The third party receives information from the first party. (i.e., the first party explicitly shares data with third-party)

values.name: Collect on first party website/app
values.description: The third party explicitly collects data from users on the first party website/app, e.g., by functionality on the website/app that allows users to directly provide information to the third party, such as social media sharing buttons or commenting forms.

values.name: Track on first party website/app
values.description: The third party implicitly collects data about users directly on the first party website/app, typically without the user being aware of it, e.g., by tracking users with cookies, beacons, third party ad libraries, or other functionality.

values.name: See
values.description: Third-party can see user information that is publicly available either on the website/app or somewhere else. Remember, a third-party can be another user of the website/app. The difference to “receive” is that the information is available but not explicitly given to a specific third party.

values.name: Other
values.description: How the third party collects or receives user information is specified in the policy but it is not covered by the options above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: The type of collection is not specified or unclear, e.g., “Our outside partners collect your personal information” without further specification whether the collection occurs on a website, app, offline, etc.

attributes.name: Identifiability
attributes.description: Use this optional attribute if if it is explicitly stated whether the information or data practice is linked to the user's identity or if it is anonymous. Defaults to "not selected."

values.name: Identifiable
values.description: It is explicitly stated that the information/data practice is linked to the user's identity.

values.name: Aggregated or anonymized
values.description: The collected data is anonymized (e.g., link to user's identity is removed) or aggregated (e.g., merged with other users' information so that it is not possible to uniquely identify a single user).

values.name: Other
values.description: The policy makes an explicit statement about identifiability that is not covered by the options above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: It is not explicitly stated or unclear if the information/data practice is linked to the user's identity.

attributes.name: Personal Information Type
attributes.description: What category of information is shared with, collected by or otherwise obtained by the third-party.

values.name: Financial
values.description: Financial information, e.g., credit/debit card data, other payment information, credit scores, etc.

values.name: Health
values.description: Health Information, such as information about health conditions, prescriptions, medication, as well as health monitoring data, e.g., heart rate, step count, activity level, etc.

values.name: Contact
values.description: Contact Information, e.g., name, email address, phone number, street address, etc.

values.name: Location
values.description: Geo-location information (e.g., user's current location) regardless of granularity, i.e., could be exact location, ZIP code, city-level.

values.name: Demographic
values.description: Demographic Information, e.g., gender, age, occupation, education, etc.

values.name: Personal identifier
values.description: Identifiers that uniquely identify a person,e.g., SSN, driver's license number, etc.

values.name: User online activities
values.description: The user’s online activities on the first party website/app or other websites/apps, e.g., pages visited, time spent on pages, general user behavior online, etc.

values.name: User Profile
values.description: The user’s profile on the first-party website/app and its contents, e.g., data in user profile, data that user uploaded to website/app, user comments, user profile preferences, etc. This is common for websites/apps where users can create an account or profile, e.g., on twitter, youtube, Facebook, Amazon, etc.

values.name: IP address and device IDs
values.description: Permanent (e.g., device IDs, MAC address) or temporary (e.g., IP address) identifiers of the user device (e.g., computer, mobile device, etc.) needed to establish a connection for the current browsing session.

values.name: Cookies and tracking elements
values.description: Identifiers locally stored on user's device by company/organization or third-parties including cookies, beacons, or similar that are commonly used to uniquely identify users, but that are not essential to establish a connection with the user’s device or to provide a service.

values.name: Computer information
values.description: The type of operating system (OS) or web browser that the user uses, or similar computer or device information.

values.name: Survey data
values.description: Any data that is collected through surveys.

values.name: Generic personal information
values.description: No specific type of information is mentioned, but the policy talks about “personal information” or “personal identifiable information” in general.

values.name: Other
values.description: A specific type of information not covered by the above categories.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: The type of information is not explicitly stated or unclear (e.g., refers to "information" very generically).

attributes.name: Purpose
attributes.description: What is the purpose of a third party receiving or collecting user information?

values.name: Basic service/feature
values.description: Provide a service that user explicitly requests and that is part of website/app's basic service or functionality. Examples are watching a video, reading an article, making a purchase, creating an account, contacting the company, etc.

values.name: Additional service/feature
values.description: Provide a service that the user explicitly requests but that is not a necessary part of the website/app's basic service. Additional services/features may enhance user experience or add convenience but require additional data or sharing with third parties, e.g., social media integration, comments, blog participation, a store finder that needs location information, etc.

values.name: Advertising
values.description: To show ads that are either targeted to the specific user or not targeted.

values.name: Marketing
values.description: To contact the user to offer products, services, or other promotions (e.g., send marketing emails, calling or texting user with marketing messages). Marketing typically requires the use of contact information.

values.name: Analytics/Research
values.description: For understanding the website/app’s audience, improving the website/app, inform company strategy, or general research.

values.name: Personalization/Customization
values.description: For providing user with a personalized experience, e.g., by allowing to arrange how the website/app looks, based on the user’s preferences or language, etc.

values.name: Service operation and security
values.description: For website/app operation and security, enforcement of terms of service, fraud prevention, protecting users and property, etc.

values.name: Legal requirement
values.description: For compliance with legal obligations, e.g., regulations, government data requests, government retention requests, law enforcement requests in general, etc.

values.name: Merger/Acquisition
values.description: If company/organization merges or is acquired it transfers users' information to another company/organization.

values.name: Other
values.description: Other specific purpose not covered above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: The purpose is not explicitly stated or is unclear.

attributes.name: User Type
attributes.description: Use this optional attribute if this practice applies specifically to users with an account or users without an account.

values.name: User without account
values.description: This data practice specifically applies to users that do not have an account or are not registered with the website or mobile app.

values.name: User with account
values.description: This data practice specifically applies to users with an account or who are registered with the website or mobile app.

values.name: Other
values.description: This data practice applies to a specific user type not covered by the options above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: It is not specified whether this practice applies to users with or without account.

attributes.name: Choice Type
attributes.description: Use this optional attribute if user choices are explicitly offered for this practice. Defaults to “not selected.”

values.name: Dont use service/feature
values.description: Only option is not to use the feature or service. Only select this if explicitly stated in policy (i.e., don't interpret silence as "Don't use website or feature").

values.name: Opt-in
values.description: User must consent before data can be shared with or collected/used by third party.

values.name: Opt-out link
values.description: Link provided in privacy policy, on website, in mobile app, or in email, etc.

values.name: Opt-out via contacting company
values.description: Must contact company/organization via email, phone, postal mail to opt-out.

values.name: First-party privacy controls
values.description: Website/app provides user settings for privacy configuration.

values.name: Third-party privacy controls
values.description: Choices provided by a third party (e.g., privacy settings on social media site) or industry (e.g., AdChoices Opt-out).

values.name: Browser/device privacy controls
values.description: Policy suggests the use of browser’s or mobile device’s privacy settings, e.g., to block trackers or cookies, activate Do-Not-Track, disable location sharing, clear history, etc.

values.name: Other
values.description: Other specific user choice or control option not captured above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: No user choices mentioned for this practice.

attributes.name: Choice Scope
attributes.description: Use this optional attribute to indicate the scope of user choices. In some cases, even if user choices are not clear or specific, this attribute can be selected. Defaults to “not selected.”

values.name: Collection
values.description: Choices apply to collection by or sharing with third party only.

values.name: Use
values.description: Choices apply to use by third party only.

values.name: Both
values.description: Choices apply to both collection/sharing and use.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: No specific scope of choices is mentioned.

categories.name: User Choice/Control
categories.description: Practice that describes general choices and control options available to users.

attributes.name: Choice Type
attributes.description: The type of user choice or privacy control options available to users.

values.name: Dont use service/feature
values.description: Only option is not to use the feature or service. Only select this if explicitly stated in policy (i.e., don't interpret silence as "Don't use website or feature").

values.name: Opt-in
values.description: User must consent before data can be shared with or collected/used by third party.

values.name: Opt-out link
values.description: Link provided in privacy policy, on website, in mobile app, or in email, etc.

values.name: Opt-out via contacting company
values.description: Must contact company/organization via email, phone, postal mail to opt-out.

values.name: First-party privacy controls
values.description: Website/app provides user settings for privacy configuration.

values.name: Third-party privacy controls
values.description: Choices provided by a third party (e.g., privacy settings on social media site) or industry (e.g., AdChoices Opt-out).

values.name: Browser/device privacy controls
values.description: Policy suggests the use of browser’s or mobile device’s privacy settings, e.g., to block trackers or cookies, activate Do-Not-Track, disable location sharing, clear history, etc.

values.name: Other
values.description: Other specific user choice or control option not captured above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: No user choices mentioned for this practice.

attributes.name: Choice Scope
attributes.description: What scope does the user choice or control apply to, i.e., first party collection/use or third party collection/use. Note that sometimes use of information can be limited, but the information is still collected from users.

values.name: First party collection
values.description: Choices apply to data collection by first party.

values.name: First party use
values.description: Choices apply to the use of information by first party.

values.name: Third party sharing/collection
values.description: Choices apply to data sharing with / collection by third party.

values.name: Third party use
values.description: Choices apply to the use of information by third party.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: No specific scope of choices is mentioned.

attributes.name: Personal Information Type
attributes.description: What category of information does the user choice apply to?

values.name: Financial
values.description: Financial information, such as credit/debit card data, other payment information, credit scores, etc.

values.name: Health
values.description: Health Information, such as information about health conditions, prescriptions, medication, as well as health monitoring data, e.g., heart rate, step count, activity level, etc.

values.description: Contact Information, such as name, email address, phone number, street address, etc.

values.name: Location
values.description: Geo-location information (e.g., user's current location) regardless of granularity, i.e., could be exact location, ZIP code, city-level.

values.description: A specific type of information not covered by the above categories.

values.description: The type of information is not explicitly stated or unclear (e.g., refers to "information" very generically).

attributes.description: What purpose/use of information does the user choice apply to?

values.description: Provide a service that the user explicitly requests and that is part of the website/app's basic service or functionality. Examples are watching a video, reading an article, making a purchase, creating an account, contacting the company/organization, etc.

attributes.name: User Type
attributes.description: Use this optional attribute if this practice applies specifically to users with or without an account.

values.name: User without account
values.description: This data practice specifically applies to users that do not have an account or are not registered with the website or mobile app.

values.name: User with account
values.description: This data practice specifically applies to users with an account or who are registered with the website or mobile app.

values.name: Other
values.description: This data practice applies to a specific user type not covered by the options above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: It is not specified whether this practice applies to users with or without account.

categories.name: User Access, Edit and Deletion
categories.description: Privacy practice that allows users to access, edit or delete the data that the company/organization has about them.

attributes.name: Access Type
attributes.description: Options offered for users to access, edit, delete information that the company/organization has about them.

values.name: None
values.description: Users cannot access, edit, or delete data. Only select this if explicitly stated that users don't have access, otherwise select "Unspecified."

values.name: View
values.description: Users can access their information, but not edit or delete it

values.name: Export
values.description: Users can export their information to other services or download it to own computer.

values.name: Edit information
values.description: User can modify or delete specific information

values.name: Deactivate account
values.description: User can deactivate account so that the user’s information is not visible to other users anymore, but the company/organization keeps all the data.

values.name: Delete account (partial)
values.description: User can delete account, but the company/organization may continue to keep some of the user’s data.

values.name: Delete account (full)
values.description: User can delete account and all of the user’s information is removed from company/organization’s servers/databases.

values.name: Other
values.description: An access, edit, or delete option not covered above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: Access options are not mentioned or unclear.

attributes.name: Access Scope
attributes.description: If access is offered, what data does it apply to.

values.name: User account data
values.description: Information explicitly provided by the user, such as contact,  demographic, and any other explicitly provided information that is part of the user’s profile/account. This includes user preferences and settings.

values.name: Transactional data
values.description: Purchases made, online activity, products watched, comments or questions submitted.

values.name: Profile data
values.description: Information that the company has learned about user, even if the user did not explicitly provided it

values.name: Other data about user
values.description: Other information that the company/organization has learned about the user, e.g., inferred preferences, data from other third parties, etc.

values.name: Other
values.description: A specific access scope is described that is not covered above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: Access scope is not mentioned or unclear.

attributes.name: User Type
attributes.description: Use this optional attribute if this practice applies specifically to users with or without an account.

values.name: User without account
values.description: This data practice specifically applies to users that do not have an account or are not registered with the website or mobile app.

values.name: User with account
values.description: This data practice specifically applies to users with an account or who are registered with the website or mobile app.

values.name: Other
values.description: This data practice applies to a specific user type not covered by the options above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: It is not specified whether this practice applies to users with or without account.

categories.name: Data Retention
categories.description: Privacy practice specifying the retention period for collected user information.

attributes.name: Retention Period
attributes.description: Description of the retention period, i.e., how long data is stored.

values.name: Indefinitely
values.description: Collected user information is retained indefinitely.

values.name: Limited
values.description: Data is deleted, anonymized, or aggregated at some point, but no specific retention period is stated, e.g., “only stored as long as needed to perform requested service” or “as required by legal obligations.”

values.name: Stated Period
values.description: Collected user information is deleted, anonymized or aggregated after a specific time period, e.g., “activity data is anonymized after 30 days.”

values.name: Other
values.description: A specific retention type not covered above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: Retention period is not stated or unclear.

attributes.name: Retention Purpose
attributes.description: The purpose to which the retention practice applies (may be “unspecified”).

values.name: Perform service
values.description: Collected user information is only stored as long as it is needed to perform the requested service.

values.name: Legal requirement
values.description: Collected data is only stored as long as required for legal or law enforcement purposes.

values.name: Analytics/Research
values.description: For understanding the website/app’s audience, improving the website/app, inform company strategy, or general research.

values.name: Service operation and security
values.description: For website/app operation and security, enforcement of terms of service, fraud prevention, protecting users and property, etc.

values.name: Advertising
values.description: To show ads that are either targeted to the specific user or not targeted.

values.name: Marketing
values.description: To contact the user to offer products, services, or other promotions (e.g., send marketing emails, calling or texting user with marketing messages). Marketing typically requires the use of contact information.

values.name: Other
values.description: Other specific retention purpose not covered above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: The retention purpose is not explicitly stated or is unclear.

attributes.name: Personal Information Type
attributes.description: The information type for which the retention period is specified (may be “unspecified”).

values.name: Financial
values.description: Financial information, such as credit/debit card data, other payment information, credit scores, etc.

values.name: Health
values.description: Health Information, such as information about health conditions, prescriptions, medication, as well as health monitoring data, e.g., heart rate, step count, activity level, etc.

values.name: Contact
values.description: Contact Information, such as name, email address, phone number, street address, etc.

values.name: Location
values.description: Geo-location information (e.g., user's current location) regardless of granularity, i.e., could be exact location, ZIP code, city-level.

values.name: Demographic
values.description: Demographic Information, e.g., gender, age, occupation, education, etc.

values.name: Personal identifier
values.description: Identifiers that uniquely identify a person,e.g., SSN, driver's license number, etc.

values.name: User online activities
values.description: The user's online activities on the first party website/app or other websites/apps, e.g., pages visited, time spent on pages, general user behavior online, etc.

values.name: User profile
values.description: The user’s profile on the first-party website/app and its contents, e.g., data in user profile, data that user uploaded to website, user comments, user profile preferences, etc. This is common for websites/apps where users can create an account or profile, e.g., on twitter, youtube, Facebook, Amazon, etc.

values.name: Social media data
values.description: User profile and data from a social media website/app or other third party service to which the user gave the first party access, e.g., by connecting with Facebook, twitter, or other services. Exchanged data may include user profile, photos, comments, friends, etc.

values.name: IP address and device IDs
values.description: Permanent (e.g., device IDs, MAC address) or temporary (e.g., IP address) identifiers needed to establish a connection for the current browsing session.

values.name: Cookies and tracking elements
values.description: Identifiers locally stored on user's device by website or third-parties including cookies, beacons, or similar that are commonly used to uniquely identify users, but that are not essential to establish a connection with the user’s device or to provide a service.

values.name: Computer information
values.description: The type of operating system (OS) or web browser that the user uses, or similar computer or device information.

values.name: Survey data
values.description: Any data that is collected through surveys

values.name: Generic personal information
values.description: No specific type of information is mentioned, but the policy talks about “personal information” or “personal identifiable information” in general.

values.name: Other
values.description: A specific type of information not covered by the above categories.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: The type of information is not explicitly stated or unclear (e.g., refers to "information" very generically).

categories.name: Data Security
categories.description: Practice that describes how users’ information is secured and protected, e.g., from confidentiality, integrity, or availability breaches. Common practices include the encryption of stored data and online communications.

attributes.name: Security Measure
attributes.description: Policy statements that describe the type of security that the website/app implements to protect users’ information.

values.name: Secure data transfer
values.description: Data transfer between user and website/app is encrypted, e.g., SSL, TLS, HTTPS.

values.name: Secure user authentication
values.description: User authentication, e.g., login to a user account, is encrypted/secured.

values.name: Secure data storage
values.description: Data is stored securely, e.g. in an encrypted format or database.

values.name: Data access limitation
values.description: Data is accessible to employees/third parties on a need-to-know basis.

values.name: Privacy training
values.description: The company/organization trains its employees/third parties in applicable privacy and security practices to protect user data.

values.name: Privacy review/audit
values.description: Privacy practices and security measures of the first party or third party are reviewed/audited by internal or external reviewers/auditors.

values.name: Privacy/Security program
values.description: The company/organization has a privacy or security program/organization in place addressing, for example, how to protect data against unauthorized access or privacy training for employees.

values.name: Generic
values.description: The policy makes generic security statements, e.g., “we protect your data” or “we use technology/encryption to protect your data.”

values.name: Other
values.description: A specific security measure not covered above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: Security measures are not mentioned or unclear.

categories.name: Policy Change
categories.description: The company/organization’s practices concerning if and how users will be informed of changes to its privacy policy, including any choices offered to users.

attributes.name: Change Type
attributes.description: For what type of changes to the website/app’s policy are users notified.

values.name: Non-privacy relevant change
values.description: Minor change to the privacy policy that does not significantly affect data practices.

values.name: Privacy relevant change
values.description: A change to the privacy policy significantly impacting current data practices, e.g., use, collection, sharing, retention, etc.

values.name: In case of merger or acquisition
values.description: Users are notified if the policy changes as the result of a merger or acquisition.

values.name: Other
values.description: Other specific policy change type not covered above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: It is not mentioned or unclear for what kind of policy changes users are notified.

attributes.name: Notification Type
attributes.description: How is the user notified when the privacy policy changes.

values.name: No notification
values.description: User is not notified of changes to the privacy policy.

values.name: General notice in privacy policy
values.description: The policy date is updated or information about the change is posted as part of the privacy policy site.

values.name: General notice on website
values.description: Users will be notified when visiting the main website, i.e., not only when looking at the privacy policy.

values.name: Personal notice
values.description: Users will be personally informed about a privacy policy change, e.g., via email, text message or when logging into their account.

values.name: Other
values.description: Users are notified in another specific way not covered above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: How users are notified about policy changes is not mentioned or unclear.

attributes.name: User Choice
attributes.description: What choices/options are offered to the user when the policy changes.

values.name: None
values.description: The user has no options when the policy changes.

values.name: Opt-out
values.description: Users can decline the new policy within a certain time period (e.g., 30 days), e.g., by canceling their account, opting-out of new practices, etc.

values.name: Opt-in
values.description: User must agree before their data is collected/used/shared according to the new privacy policy.

values.name: User participation
values.description: Users can decide or influence policy change (e.g., the company/organization proposes a change and asks for users' opinions).

values.name: Other
values.description: Other specific user choice not covered above.

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: Choices regarding policy changes are not mentioned or unclear.

categories.name: Do Not Track
categories.description: Practices that explain if and how Do Not Track signals (DNT) for online tracking and advertising are honored.

attributes.name: Do Not Track policy
attributes.description: If and how Do-Not-Track signals (DNT) are honored.

values.name: Not mentioned
values.description: There is no statement concerning Do Not Track

values.name: Honored
values.description: The website/app reads and adheres to the user's DNT preference

values.name: Not honored
values.description: The website/app ignores DNT headers and the user’s DNT preference.

values.name: Mentioned, but unclear if honored
values.description: DNT headers are mentioned but it is unclear if the company/organization adheres to the user's DNT preference.

values.name: Other
values.description: The website/app handles DNT headers in a different way not covered above.

categories.name: International and Specific Audiences
categories.description: Specific audiences mentioned in the company/organization’s privacy policy, such as children or international users, for which the company/organization may provide special provisions.

attributes.name: Audience Type
attributes.description: Select which audience the policy segment refers to

values.name: Californians
values.description: How data from Californian users is treated, e.g., California privacy rights.

values.name: Europeans
values.description: How data from European users is treated, e.g., Safe Harbor provisions.

values.name: Citizens from other countries
values.description: Specific provisions for international audiences or citizens from countries other than US or Europe, e.g., international data transfer.

values.name: Children
values.description: How data from children is treated.

values.name: Other
values.description: Other specific audience group not mentioned above.

categories.name: Other
categories.description: Another aspect not covered in the other categories is discussed in the text segment.

attributes.name: Other Type
attributes.description: What other aspect not covered in the other categories is discussed in the text segment?

values.name: Introductory/Generic
values.description: It's a paragraph that introduces the policy, a section, or a group of practices, but does not mention a specific privacy/data practice. The paragraph makes generic statements, but does not describe specific privacy/data practices

values.name: Practice not covered
values.description: The paragraph describes a specific data practice, which is not covered by any of the other data practice categories.

values.name: Privacy contact information
values.description: The paragraph describes how to contact the company with questions, concerns, or complaints about the privacy policy.

values.name: Other
values.description: The paragraph does not fit any of the values above.
